prs.title: NONEVM-1618 Handle history not available error
prs.truncated_body:
PR contains:
* Log critical error for every instance of history not available error
* If job failed more than max number of attempts, log critical error with errors from all previous retries
*  Capture logs from Solana docker image, when running e2e tests
* Reduce number of tickets per slot from 64 to 8 to speed up tests and reduce flakyness
* Log error details for FundAccount operation

commits.message: log ciritical error if history is not available

prs.title: ctb,op-deployer: Remove deployconfig from l2genesis
prs.truncated_body: First PR in a series that updates the `L2Genesis` script to use structs for input rather than the `DeployConfig` contract or environment variables. To prove equivalency between the new and old `L2Genesis` scripts, this PR adds a new `L2Genesis2` script and leaves the old one in place. The unit tests then run both scripts on the same input, and assert that the output is the same. The old script wil

prs.title: op-test-sequencer: update TODO
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

Fixes TODO comment to point to new github issue that tracks the actual thing. The previous issue was too wide, and captured the base functionality that was merged already in https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/14604

prs.title: op-service: add support for enable/disable JWT auth per RPC handler route
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

This PR is adding support for explicitly specifying authentication per RPC handler route, on top of the default JWT authentication.

**Tests**

I added `TestHandlerAuthentication` which tests RPC to the same service via differently setup authentication routes.

**Additional context**

**Metadata**

Fixes: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/15565

commits.message: add support for optional jwt auth (AddRPCWithAuthentication method)

prs.title: op-test-sequencer: introduce standard builder/signer/committer/publisher
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

This introduces:
- op-node API to serve (enabled with feature-flag `--experimental.opstack-api`):
  - `opstack_openBlockV1`
  - `opstack_cancelBlockV1`
  - `opstack_sealBlockV1`
  - `opstack_commitBlockV1`
  - `opstack_publishBlockV1`
- op-service changes:
  - payloadInfo (payload ID and timestamp) is now an API type
  - add RPC client bindings for above opstack methods

commits.message: op-test-sequencer: standard builder, committer, publisher, signer

prs.title: Finalize gateway scripts

# What ❔

- Most of gateway-related scripts were moved to `AcceptAdmin.s.sol` file, which is related to everything done by the Admin. The expected flow is that zkstack_cli would use this script to encode the calls to call the ChainAdmin contract with.
- The calls are encoded in this single place to ensure minimal code repetition and the same commands could be reused for unit tests of Gateway

prs.title: feat(contracts/solve): integrate hyperlane
prs.truncated_body: Integrated Hyperlane as an alternative messaging provider to help us expand to more chains quickly in the short term. The `SolverNetInbox` can receive fulfillment attestations regardless of if they are routed via Omni Core or Hyperlane. The `SolverNetOutbox` can be configured to use either Omni Core or Hyperlane to route fulfillment attestations to an Inbox on any given chain. There are no breakin

## Describe your changes and provide context
This is implementation of  https://github.com/ethereum/RIPs/blob/master/RIPS/rip-7212.md

A precompiled contract that performs signature verifications in the `secp256r1` or `P-256` elliptic curve by given parameters of message hash, r and s components of the signature, x and y coordinates of the public key. 

This enables passkeys based use cases a

prs.title: fix: fluid max payback
prs.truncated_body:
### Summary

For really small positions on Fluid, a 0.001% max payback bump won't be enough. For example: Debt stored on Fluid is 16574411, we bump to 16574581, but it fails on Fluid as it will try to pull more, e.g., 16574908. The fix is to increase the bump, in this case to 0.01%, which should be enough for all position sizes.

### Type of change
- [ ] Breaking Change - A change that is not

commits.message:
fix: increase max payback bump on FluidVaultT1Payback

For really small positions, 0.001% won't be enough. For example:
Debt stored on fluid 16574411, we bump to 16574581, but fails on Fluid as it will try to pull more, like 16574908. The fix is to increase the bump, in this case to 0.01% which should be enough for all positions sizes.
fix: increase max payback bump on FluidVaultT1Adjust
chore: add new FluidVaultT1Payback and FluidVaultT1Adjust addresses

prs.title: feat(pulse): keeper payment
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Add keeper payment in `updatePriceFeeds`

## Rationale

Keepers are permissionless and we pay them in-band if they successfully call `updatePriceFeeds`. If the trigger condition isn't satisfied or the subscription doesn't have enough funds, they won't get paid.

This is a temporary payment model, the long term goal is to add a monthly subscription to make it easy for users to c

commits.message: fix: let gasbenchmark test contract accept payment
fix: use checks-effects-interactions for the pyth and keeper fees

prs.title: fix(entropy): Use the block number of event instead of request data for revelation api
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Improve revelations api for arbitrum based chains

## Rationale

Current revelations api doesn't work well where `block.number` on-chain is different from what rpc returns. In arbitrum based chains, one points to the L1 block and the other to the L2 block.

## How has this been tested?

- [ ] Current tests cover my changes
- [ ] Added new tests
- [x] Manually tested the cod

commits.message: Use the block number of event instead of request data for revelation api
Move block_number to optional get argument

prs.title: fix(entropy): Restore old signatures for methods returning structs
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

As the description says -- it turns out that you can't decode the old struct data with the new struct format. This restores the old method signatures and adds new methods for retrieving the new versions of the structs.

I don't love that we have new methods here for retrieving requests / providers, but that's the only way I see to ensure that all users of the contract continue work

prs.title: fix(entropy): Fix Event definitions to maintain backward compatibility
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Bring back the original EntropyStructs definitions and move the new structs to EntropyStructsV2. Use the old EntropyStructs in events to maintain the selectors.

## Rationale

The last few Entropy PRs have added fields to the contract structs, which were backward compatible with the storage. However, these changes change the selectors of Events, which breaks the public interface

## Purpose  
This PR improves the warning message for Spanish speakers using valid characters (á, é, í, ó, ú, ü, ñ) in ENS names:  
- Reduces false alarms for correct Spanish orthography  
- Educates users about character preservation  
- References Unicode TR36 for technical accuracy

prs.title: Add support for automatic restoration for the 'recording' mode.
prs.truncated_body:
### What

Add support for automatic restoration for the 'recording' mode.
This includes support in a few different places:

- e2e_invoke
- invocation metering
- simulation

In order to make them all work consistently, the auto-restoration logic has been moved directly into recording mode of the storage. I did some cleanup of the unused `pub` storage methods, as it's no longer feasible to

commits.message:
Add support for automatic restoration for the 'recording' mode.

This includes support in a few different places:

- e2e_invoke
- invocation metering
- simulation

In order to make them all work consistently, the auto-restoration logic has been moved directly into recording mode of the storage. I did some cleanup of the unused `pub` storage methods, as it's no longer feasible to support these.

The `SnapshotSource` interface now assumes that archived entries should be returned, thus `SnapshotSourceWithArchive` is removed from the simulation library. However, we still keep `AutorestoringSnapshotSource` in order to allow bypassing automatic restoration on the host side (this allows the users to optionally run the simulation without the auto-restoration simulation and rely on a standalone restore operation instead).
Merge branch 'autorestore' of https://github.com/dmkozh/rs-soroban-env into autorestore

running `stellar hello` with args:

running `stellar h

commits.message:
go/consensus/cometbft/light: Lazy initialize light client

To initialize the CometBFT light client, a valid trusted light block is
required. However, if no peers are available at startup or if the available
peers do not have the requested light block, initialization fails.
This causes consensus state synchronization from a checkpoint to fail,
and the node must be restarted. To address this issue, we implemented
lazy initialization for the client. If initialization fails initially,
the system will retry initialization on subsequent requests.
go/consensus/cometbft/light: Remove light provider type assertion

prs.title: fix rpcchainvm handling for arbitrary length http body
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

Fixes a bug in rpcchainvm where a arbitrary length http body will hang when attempting to copy the body into protobuf.

## How this works

Instead of copying the body into a proto message, wrap the http body in an implementation of `io.Reader` that streams the message body. 

## How this was tested

Added a regression test

## Need to be documented in RELE

commits.message:
fix rpcchainvm bug where body is not copied

prs.title: Prover/limitless ser deser
prs.truncated_body:
- Refactored and broke down all large monolithic functions in the entire package into modular functions with separation of concerns.
- Used a `bufferPool` and `readerPool` to reuse CBOR encoder/decoder respectively and initialize the CBOR encoder/decoder mode only once since it is used repeatedly.
- Parallelized serialization and deserialization of compiled IOP objects.

prs.title: Modify findByIdAndTimestamp query
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
It was observed that the findByIdAndTimestamp query tends to execute slower that expected, so this PR proposes a query optimization. In the original query the left join joins the entire token table to the subquery using the token_id.
The optimizer has to evaluate the whole table or at least use an index scan on token_id. The larger the token table, the larger in impact on the pe

prs.title: feat: Extend `SetKeyWithAlias` funcs to support `PublicKey`
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
Update and unify the method signatures to accept a more flexible input type, such as `Key`, which can represent either an ECDSA `PrivateKey` or a `PublicKey`. The updated behavior should support both scenarios:

- If a **PrivateKey** is provided: use it to set the key and internally derive the alias from its corresponding **public key**.
- If a **PublicKey** is provided: use i

prs.title: Native: adjust hardfork activation definition
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

### Problem:

Consider a hardfork (`Echidna` in our case) that is:
 1. Explicitly omitted from the node configuration;
 2. Given the fact that the set of previous hardforks are explicitly enabled in the node configuration.
 
 The problem is that this hardfork is treated as "enabled from genesis" by `IsInitializeBlock` function. This problem is discovered when running N3 mai

commits.message:
Native: adjust hardfork activation definition

Problem:

Consider a hardfork (Echidna in our case) that is:
 1. Explicitly ommitted from the node configuration;
 2. Given the fact that the set of previous hardforks are explicitly enabled
    in the node configuration.
The problem is that this hardfork is treated as "enabled from genesis"
by `IsInitializeBlock` function.

This problem is discovered when running N3 mainnet/testnet node with the default
configuration on the current master. This behaviour leads to unexected
Echidna-related changes being included into the node state starting from genesis
block. Here are some data:

Hardforks configuration that is used in config.json file (given this
config, Echidna should be treated as disabled):
```
    "Hardforks": {
      "HF_Aspidochelone": 210000,
      "HF_Basilisk": 2680000,
      "HF_Cockatrice": 3967000,
      "HF_Domovoi": 4144000
    },
```

Genesis block state difference between the current master and 3.7 version:
```
Processing directory BlockStorage_0
file BlockStorage_0/dump-block-0.json: block 0, changes length mismatch: 34 vs 41
```

In particular, there are 7 extra storage items stored in genesis. All
these changes relate to new functionality added in Echidna hardfork
(Policy extensions, Notary contract and etc.):
```
        {
            "id": -7,
            "key": "+f///xQi",
            "state": "Added",
            "value": "gJaYAA=="
        },
        {
            "id": -7,
            "key": "+f///xU=",
            "state": "Added",
            "value": "mDo="
        },
        {
            "id": -7,
            "key": "+f///xY=",
            "state": "Added",
            "value": "gBY="
        },
        {
            "id": -7,
            "key": "+f///xc=",
            "state": "Added",
            "value": "gBQg"
        },
        {
            "id": -1,
            "key": "/////wg77DUxEZu6123QRJILDebDGU/hwQ==",
            "state": "Added",
            "value": ""
        },
        {
            "id": -1,
            "key": "/////wz////2",
            "state": "Added",
            "value": "O+w1MRGbutdt0ESSCw3mwxlP4cE="
        },
        {
            "id": -10,
            "key": "9v///wo=",
            "state": "Added",
            "value": "jAA="
        },
```

Solution:

Since EnsureOmittedHardforks is always applied to configured hardfork
values, this function ensures that all omitted hardfork heights are set
to 0. We don't need additional checks anywhere and can rely on
settings.Hardforks explicitly after that. If hardfork is not in
settings.Hardforks then it is disabled.

Originaly it was an intention of https://github.com/neo-project/neo/pull/2942#discussion_r1385335080,
but somehow we missed this bug during review.

Signed-off-by: Anna Shaleva <shaleva.ann@nspcc.ru>
